00020 /**
00021  * @file   ProgressHandler.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Fri Jan 27 14:31:52 2006
00024  * 
00025  * @brief Abtract interface for a class which interprets progress. Register your
00026  * ProgressHandler with the Verbose class to handle progress calls.
00027  * 
00028  */
00029 
00030 
00031 #ifndef PROGRESSHANDLER_H
00032 #define PROGRESSHANDLER_H
00033 
00034 #include <cstring>
00035 #include <string>
00036 //
00037 
00038 /**
00039  * @brief An abstract class for handling Progress updates.
00040  */
00041 class ProgressHandler {
00042 
00043 public:
00044 
00045   /** Virtual destructor for a virtual class. */
00046   virtual ~ProgressHandler() {}
00047 
00048   /** Does this object handle all the calls or just want signals every
00049       dotMod */
00050   virtual bool handleAll() { return false; }
00051 
00052   /** 
00053    * Begin a progress reporting. After this initial call the
00054    * progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter
00055    * total passed in below.
00056    * 
00057    * @param verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress
00058    * associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more
00059    * messages.
00060    * @param msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
00061    * @param total - Expected number of times that the progressStep()
00062    * will be called after this.
00063    */
00064   virtual void progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total) = 0;
00065 
00066   /** 
00067    * This function is called when one unit of work has been done. In
00068    * general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly
00069    * equal in size.
00070    * 
00071    * @param verbosity - At what verbosity level should this step be
00072    * displayed.
00073    */
00074   virtual void progressStep(int verbosity) = 0;
00075 
00076   /** 
00077    * Signals the end of progress report. 
00078    * 
00079    * @param verbosity - Level of verbosity associated with this progress report.
00080    * @param msg - Closing message from calling function.
00081    */
00082   virtual void progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg) = 0;
00083 
00084   /** 
00085    * What level of verbosity is requested. This is a hint to the class and can
00086    * be ignored if desired.
00087    * 
00088    * @param level - Level below which progress messages are printed.
00089    */
00090   virtual void setBaseVerbosity(int level) { m_Verbosity = level; }
00091 
00092 protected:
00093   
00094   int m_Verbosity;  ///< What level of verbosity is processed, higher == more messages.
00095 
00096 };
00097 
00098 #endif /* PROGRESSHANDLER_H */
